main event: Dr. C. S. Tomkins reported seeing a 'flying saucer' moving rapidly from north to south over Chicago on July 1, 1950.
interesting points: The object was reported to have covered the distance from north horizon to south horizon in just 2 seconds., The object was described as round, intensive, and brilliant, differing from known meteors., Dr. Tomkins noted the object traveled horizontally at high altitude and claimed it resembled a ball of fire., No photos were taken during the observation., The conclusion of the report identified the object as an 'Astro (meteor)'.
witness description: Dr. C. S. Tomkins, who is familiar with meteor appearances.
